context.description: This dialog allows you set configure the active synchronization in the Synchronize View.
This dialog allows you to configure the active synchronization to be automatically refreshed at a specified interval.
This page helps you select what type of target site you wish to connect the project to.

This page helps you import a project set from a file on the file system or directly from a URL. A project set is a lightweight description of a set of shared projects. It can be used to reconstruct a lineup of shared projects that you have in your workspace.

This page helps you export a project set to a file which can be shared with other team members. A project set is a lightweight description of a set of shared projects. It can be used to reconstruct a lineup of shared projects that you have in your workspace.
This page allows you to choose the resources that are to be synchronized.
This page allows you to choose the type of synchronization you want to create.

You may wish to exclude certain resources from version control. Resources whose names match any enabled pattern will not be released. The wildcard characters '*' and '?' are permitted. Examples: '/*/a/*' matches all files and sub-folders in '/x/a/' and also in '/x/y/z/a/', '/?/a/*' matches all in '/x/a/', '/?/a/*.doc' matches all .doc files in '/x/a/' folder and its sub-folders. These settings will not affect resources already under version control.
This page allows you to manage which models are available in the Synchronize view.
This page allows you to configure various aspects of the Synchronize View.
This page allows you to configure whether the Synchronize view is populated automatically when Eclipse starts.
This page allows you to configure how file system resources appear in the synchronize view.
This page allows you to associate a file extension with its content type (ASCII or binary). These setting are used by repository providers, such as CVS

topic.label: Setting the content type of a file extension

context.description: Downloads the selected resources from the site into your workspace.
Uploads the selected resources from your workspace to the site.
Show any differences between the local and remote site state of the selected resources in the Synchronize view.
Downloads the selected resources from the site into your workspace. You may specify the local name of the resources.
Downloads the selected resources from the site into your workspace. A project is created in the workspace for each of the selected items.
Discards the selected target sites from the list of remembered sites.
This view shows incoming, outgoing and conflicting changes.
Downloads the selected resources from the site into your workspace.
Uploads the selected resources from your workspace to the site.
Shares the selected project with any version control management systems available in Eclipse.
Applies a patch to files and folders in your workspace.
The Site Explorer view allows you to browse of the contents of known target sites and download remote resources into the local workspace.
The Synchronize view allows the synchronization of the local contents of the workspace with a remote repository or target.
The Local History view allows users to view the local history of a file or an element contained in a file.
Creates a new target site to which you can upload or download resources.
Creates a new folder on the target site.
Refreshes the contents of the view.
Show the comparison of the local and remote contents of the file in the comparison viewer.
Fully expands all selected items.
Removes the selected items from the Synchronize view.
Selects and reveals the selected items in the Navigator view.
